title: U.S.-Made Armored Vehicles Appear to Have Been Used in Attack on Russia
description: At least three of what appeared to be American-made tactical vehicles known as MRAPs were part of the cross-border attack. According to visual evidence, Russia captured two of them.

title: Mexican President Said He Told Ally Not to Worry About Being Spied On
description: The leader acknowledged that he had been told the government’s top human rights official was targeted by spyware, but sought to downplay the surveillance on Tuesday.

title: ‘Time Shelter,’ by Georgi Gospodinov, Wins International Booker Prize
description: Georgi Gospodinov’s acclaimed satire, translated by Angela Rodel, is the first Bulgarian novel to win the prestigious award.

title: F-16 Training Planned for Ukraine’s Pilots
description: Ukrainian pilots have a lot to learn before they can start using U.S.-made fighter jets, but experts say it might take less time than once thought.

title: Boris Johnson Referred to Police Over Potential New Covid Breach
description: The former prime minister was fined last year while still the head of government for breaking Covid rules in 2020, one of a series of scandals that eventually led to his resignation.

title: As Migration to U.K. Soars, Britain Targets Visas for Students’ Kin
description: The government, which has been mostly focused on asylum seekers crossing the English Channel, is now turning to limiting some pathways for legal migrants.

title: U.S. Navy Steps Up Efforts to Curb Iran’s Ship Seizures in Strait of Hormuz
description: The United States is increasing patrols in the busy shipping lanes, where Iranian forces have taken two internationally flagged tankers in recent weeks.

title: Who Are the Soldiers Behind the Free Russia Legion?
description: The unit has taken responsibility for a rare assault in Russian territory, and a member says it is just the beginning.

title: The Madeleine McCann Case: Here’s What We Know
description: A new search in Portugal has brought the case of the British girl, missing since 2007, back to the headlines.

title: Russian Judge Agrees to Extend Evan Gershkovich’s Detention for Three Months
description: Mr. Gershkovich has been held at the notoriously harsh Lefortovo jail since his arrest on March 29 during a reporting trip to the central Russian city of Yekaterinburg. His detention was extended for three months.

title: With Pardon of Roman Protasevich, Belarus Fuels a Tale of Betrayal
description: Roman Protasevich became a symbol of the struggle for democracy when Belarus forced down a plane and arrested him. Now it has pardoned him, and former allies say he has turned on them.

title: China and Russia, Targets of a Contentious G7 Summit, Draw Closer
description: Beijing and Moscow are holding visits this week as alarm grows in China that Western countries backing Ukraine are turning their attention to Asia.

title: Australia Reckons With Stan Grant’s Exit from ABC Over Racist Abuse
description: Stan Grant, an Indigenous journalist, was attacked on social media after talking during coronation coverage about the brutality of colonialism.

title: Prince Harry Loses Bid to Pay for Police Protection in UK
description: The decision comes a week after he and his wife, Meghan, said they were chased by paparazzi in Manhattan. The Home Office said that nobody should be allowed to, in effect, hire officers as guards.

title: Ron DeSantis’s Reality
description: The challenges that Gov. Ron DeSantis faces in any presidential run go beyond Donald Trump.

title: Russian Fighters Aligned With Ukraine Mount Rare Assault Inside Russia
description: The governor of a Russian border region said that local forces were responding after an apparent attack by anti-Kremlin fighters.

title: The Battle for Bakhmut, in Photos
description: Times photographers have been documenting Ukraine’s defense of the Eastern city since May 2022.

title: Turkey’s Next President Will Win an Economy in Peril
description: A surge in government spending before the election this month and pressure on the country’s currency could hit the economy in coming months, experts say.

title: How Women Are Giving Birth Amid Chaos in Sudan
description: War in the northeast African nation has forced pregnant women to drive “through hell” to reach the dwindling number of hospitals and clinics, or turn to overworked midwives to give birth at home.

title: An African Country Faces Challenges to Protect Girls From HPV
description: Almost all cervical cancer deaths now occur in developing countries. Tanzania is trying to inoculate girls against the virus that causes the disease — nearly 20 years after rich countries began offering the shot.

title: 4 Everest Ascents in 10 Days: Sherpas Battle for a Climbing Record
description: The friendly but grueling competition mixes monetary rewards with abundant dangers for a pair of veteran mountain guides.

title: U.S. Shift to Support F-16s for Ukraine Began A Month Ago
description: The U.S. defense chief first asked Biden officials to support the plan after meeting with European allies. He made his pitch to President Biden last week.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Bakhmut is obliterated.
